It is thus: because this exists, that exists; due to the arising of this, that arises. From ignorance as a condition there are karmic formations, from karmic formations as a condition there is consciousness, from consciousness as a condition there is name-and-form, from name-and-form as a condition there are the six sense bases, from the six sense bases as a condition there is contact, from contact as a condition there is feeling, from feeling as a condition there is craving, from craving as a condition there is grasping, from grasping as a condition there is becoming, from becoming as a condition there is birth, from birth as a condition there is old age, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress. Thus arises the whole mass of suffering.

It is thus: because this does not exist, that does not exist; due to the cessation of this, that ceases. From the cessation of ignorance comes the cessation of karmic formations, from the cessation of karmic formations comes the cessation of consciousness, from the cessation of consciousness comes the cessation of name-and-form, from the cessation of name-and-form comes the cessation of the six sense bases, from the cessation of the six sense bases comes the cessation of contact, from the cessation of contact comes the cessation of feeling, from the cessation of feeling comes the cessation of craving, from the cessation of craving comes the cessation of grasping, from the cessation of grasping comes the cessation of becoming, from the cessation of becoming comes the cessation of birth, from the cessation of birth comes the cessation of old age, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress. Thus ceases the whole mass of suffering.
